subject: Parenting
title: How Stress Shapes the Brain
description: A fast breakdown of How Stress Shapes the Brain for builders.

hook.text: A little stress helps children build resilience. A lot of it damages their brains.

buildup.text: Cortisol in small doses sharpens attention and memory.

discovery.text: Chronic stress floods a young brain with cortisol, shrinking memory and reasoning centers.

climax.text: One stable, caring adult can buffer the damage. Relationships are the antidote.

punchline.text: Stress shapes the brain. Love shapes it back.
